page.title: 20Trade in Ripe.
page.content: Adjacent to the General Stores in the centre of Ripe is the butchers shop. It is run as a family butchers by Mr. Alan Priest who has only recently taken it on. A large selection of quality meat is sold. Deliveries are made daily to local residents including Deanland Wood Caravan Site. Local Public houses and restaurants are also supplied. Opposite to the shops in the centre of Ripe is The Lamb Inn. This quiet country pub has two licensees, Mr. Robert Robinson and his wife Anne. There are two bars and a restaurant area, a childrens room and a garden. It is a free house and the beer is excellent. Meals are cooked in the kitchen and served either as bar snacks or in the restaurant area. Quiz nights are held every Tuesday and pub games are making a comeback.
